title: Piers Morgan makes dig at Simon Cowell's face on 60th birthday
text:
Piers wished Simon a happy birthday…with added cheek

As he celebrated his pal Simon Cowell’s birthday, Piers Morgan couldn’t resist kicking in the boot.

Classic Piers.

As the Britain’s Got Talent judge turned 60 today, Good Morning Britain’s Piers shared a photo of the two of them when they worked together.

Piers was one of the judges on the talent show over four seasons from 2007-2010 and while he may not work alongside Simon anymore, that doesn’t mean his former colleague is immune from a good ol’ fashioned birthday ribbing.

Taking to Instagram on Monday morning, Piers wrote alongside the snap: ‘Happy 60th Birthday to my (very) old mate @simoncowell. A great guy to whom I owe a lot…’

The 54-year-old continued: ‘But no amount of plastic surgery can change the fact his age now begins with a 6 and mine with a 5…’

There it is.

Simon hasn’t shied away from talking about having Botox in the past, with his rather smooth forehead, plump cheeks, lean physique and alarmingly white teeth raising eyebrows (so to speak) earlier this year.

The X Factor judge has never admitted to going under the knife but has been open about his love of Botox, saying in 2008 that it was as commonplace as brushing your teeth.

He told Glamour: ‘To me, Botox is no more unusual than toothpaste. It works, you do it once a year – who cares?’

Simon turns 60 today (Picture: Rex Features)

However, he later admitted to overdoing it on the fillers, which smooth out wrinkles by temporarily paralysing muscles – something that may have contributed to a heavy brow, caused by loss of support from his forehead muscles.

Simon also turned to a ‘21st century facelift’ last year to spruce himself up, opting for a ‘Silhouette Soft Lift’ from Dr Jean-Louis Sebagh, who is nicknamed the Picasso of dermatology.

The procedure, which costs £2,000, involves sewing a bioplastic-infused thread into the face and tugging it to reduce sagging.

Simon told The Sun: ‘There’s lots of things you can do now. You don’t just have to stuff your face with filler and Botox.

‘It hurts like hell but it gets rid of sun damage and unplugs all the crap. For me now, it’s all about having clean skin. If you have clean skin, you look better.’

Still, after turning to a vegan diet this year which saw him shed 20lbs – for the sake of his five-year-old son Eric – Simon may be celebrating one of his healthiest birthdays yet at the age of 60.

Happy birthday, Si!
